intro: Adhatoda dipteracantha, commonly known as the blue-flowered adhatoda, is a perennial shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves and clusters of small, blue or violet flowers. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Its flowers are typically visited by various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. The plant is also noted for its medicinal properties, used traditionally in herbal remedies.
